poem:
### The City's Countenance

In the heart's theatre,  
a stage shifts,  
facades of time  
masking whispers of revolt.  
Unseen architects  
mould with quiet hands,  
new vigour rising  
in ink-drenched sighs.  
Shelved dreams  
breathe dust's defiance;  
a pulse in the subterranean,  
each line penned  
a vagrant hope  
against the mundane sky.
